department_name: Department of Forestry, Bio-Diversity and Tourism

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Forestry
courses.description: This program focuses on sustainable forest management, conservation of biodiversity, and utilization of forest resources.

course_units.title: Introduction to Forestry
course_units.description: Overview of forest ecosystems and forestry practices.

course_units.title: Forest Botany
course_units.description: Botanical characteristics of forest trees and plants.

course_units.title: Principles of Ecology
course_units.description: Fundamental ecological concepts relevant to forest ecosystems.

course_units.title: Forest Soils
course_units.description: Properties and management of soils in forest ecosystems.

course_units.title: Dendrology
course_units.description: Identification and classification of trees and woody plants.

course_units.title: Forestry Mathematics
course_units.description: Mathematical methods applied to forestry.

course_units.title: Silviculture
course_units.description: Principles and practices of growing and managing forests.

course_units.title: Forest Mensuration
course_units.description: Techniques for measuring forest resources.

course_units.title: Forest Economics
course_units.description: Economic principles applied to forest resources.

course_units.title: Forest Protection
course_units.description: Protection of forests from pests, diseases, and fire.

course_units.title: Biodiversity Conservation
course_units.description: Principles and practices of biodiversity conservation.

course_units.title: Forest Products
course_units.description: Utilization and processing of forest products.

course_units.title: Forest Management
course_units.description: Planning and management of forest resources.

course_units.title: Remote Sensing for Forestry
course_units.description: Application of remote sensing techniques in forestry.

course_units.title: Agroforestry
course_units.description: Integration of trees with agricultural crops and livestock.

course_units.title: Forest Policy and Governance
course_units.description: Policies and regulatory frameworks for forest management.

course_units.title: Urban Forestry
course_units.description: Management of trees and forests in urban settings.

course_units.title: Forest Certification
course_units.description: Standards and certification processes for sustainable forestry.

course_units.title: Climate Change and Forestry
course_units.description: Role of forests in climate change mitigation and adaptation.

course_units.title: Forest Resource Assessment
course_units.description: Methods for assessing and monitoring forest resources.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Forestry
course_units.description: Research methodologies for forestry and related fields.

course_units.title: Forestry Capstone Project
course_units.description: Independent research project in forestry.

course_units.title: Forest Restoration
course_units.description: Principles and practices of forest ecosystem restoration.

course_units.title: Professional Practice in Forestry
course_units.description: Professional and ethical aspects of forestry practice.

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Tourism
courses.description: This program equips students with knowledge and skills for careers in tourism planning, management, and sustainable development.

course_units.title: Introduction to Tourism
course_units.description: Overview of the tourism industry and its components.

course_units.title: Tourism Geography
course_units.description: Geographical aspects of tourism destinations and attractions.

course_units.title: Principles of Conservation
course_units.description: Basic concepts and practices of conservation for tourism.

course_units.title: Tourism Economics
course_units.description: Economic principles and impacts of tourism.

course_units.title: Customer Service in Tourism
course_units.description: Principles and practices of customer service in tourism settings.

course_units.title: Tourism Communication
course_units.description: Communication skills for tourism professionals.

course_units.title: Sustainable Tourism
course_units.description: Principles and practices of sustainable tourism development.

course_units.title: Tourism Marketing
course_units.description: Marketing concepts and strategies for tourism destinations and businesses.

course_units.title: Tourism Policy and Planning
course_units.description: Policy frameworks and planning approaches for tourism development.

course_units.title: Ecotourism
course_units.description: Principles and practices of ecological tourism.

course_units.title: Tourism Business Management
course_units.description: Management of tourism businesses and enterprises.

course_units.title: Heritage Tourism
course_units.description: Management and interpretation of cultural and heritage tourism sites.

course_units.title: Tourism Impact Assessment
course_units.description: Methods for assessing the impacts of tourism development.

course_units.title: Tourism Information Systems
course_units.description: Information technology applications in tourism.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Tourism
course_units.description: Research methodologies for tourism studies.

course_units.title: Tourism Capstone Project
course_units.description: Independent research project in tourism.

course_units.title: Tourism Entrepreneurship
course_units.description: Entrepreneurial approaches to tourism business development.

course_units.title: Tourism Internship
course_units.description: Practical experience in the tourism industry.
